title: Single Select
contents:
Single Selectlink

Simply use multiselect dropdown as a single select by specifying multiselect property binding as false. Also by default it is set to false. Also you can hook up on different events of the multiselect dropdown.

For single select dropdown, the helper buttons such as *Select All*, *Select None* won't be shown because they are not required here.

Single select Demolink

<ngx-multiselect [(ngModel)]="selectedCountry" [options]="countries" [multiple]="false" ngDefaultControl> </ngx-multiselect> import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'ms-single-select', templateUrl: './single-select.component.html', }) export class SingleSelectComponent implements OnInit { countries; selectedCountry; constructor() { } ngOnInit() { this.countries = [{ id: 1, name: "India"}, { id: 2, name: "USA" }, { id: 3, name: "China" }, { id: 4, name: "Japan" }, { id: 5, name: "Australia" }, { id: 6, name: "Brazil" } ]; this.selectedCountry = { id: 1, name: "India" }; } }
